Class Choice

  • java.lang.Object
    • Choice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IChoice

    public class Choice
extends java.lang.Object
implements IChoice
    Cast Vote. This is the class that deals with a single cast vote choice. also takes line of data and parses each individual datum Copyright (C) 2012 by Duncan A. Buell. All rights reserved.
    Version:
    1.00 2012-12-20
    Author:
    Duncan A. Buell modified by Patrick Hamod

    • Method Detail

      • extractPctData

        public void extractPctData(java.lang.String pctData)
        Method to extract the precinct information from the 'String'. Extracting the pct info means getting rid of the "PRECINCT" and the hyphen from the input, taking the next piece of the 'String' as the pct number, and then taking rest of the input 'String' as the name of the pct. We make judicious use of 'trim()' in order to limit ourselves only to real data.
        Specified by:
        extractPctData in interface IChoice
        Parameters:
        pctData - the 'String' from which to extract

      • parseInput

        public void parseInput(java.lang.String pctData,
              java.lang.String inputLine)
        Method to parse an input line to create a cast vote choice. First we extract the pct info from the 'pctData' input parameter. Then we convert the input line to a 'Scanner' and read off the info one at a time. The only tricky part is that we may or may not have an asterisk so we have a variable number of strings to extract. If we have the asterisk at the appropriate location, we assume that we have a new vote and we bump that counter.
        Specified by:
        parseInput in interface IChoice
        Parameters:
        pctData - and inputLine to get scan for variables.
